To determine if the displacements of cars A and B are the same, examine the area under the velocity-time graph for each car.
The velocity-time graph shows the relationship between velocity and time for cars A and B.
Car A's graph has a curved shape indicating increasing velocity over time.
Car B's graph has a different curve indicating decreasing velocity over time.
The second image has red lines showing the areas under the curves for cars A and B.
The area under the curve for Car A is larger than the area under the curve for Car B.
The displacement of Car A is greater than the displacement of Car B during the time interval from t=0 to t=t1.
The displacements of cars A and B are not the same.
